alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 3:01AM PST until December 28 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 3 PM PST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM THURSDAY TO 3 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, nuisance to minor coastal flooding during morning high tides. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected around morning high tides. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. Local sets of 15 to 20 feet will be likely near Point Conception. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Wednesday afternoon. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 3 AM to 3 PM PST Thursday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 3 AM Thursday to 3 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of sea water is likely, around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as parking lots, beaches, and walkways. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest surf will be across west facing beaches. During the Coastal Flood Advisory, the high surf combined with relatively high tides of 6.5 to 6.7 feet (occuring around 9:00 AM Thursday) may result in more significant coastal flooding and beach erosion.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
